name: Armakuni
description:
In an era where speed to market is the key differentiator, Armakuni are specialists in driving the cultural and technical change required to build high quality, robust & reliable software products at high velocity.

We work with a wide range of organisations, from start-ups to global enterprises providing a mix of consultancy, training, adoption programmes, team augmentation and outcome delivery to embed and accelerate the use of Cloud Native technology and practices.

We specialise in software and infrastructure delivery, primarily on cloud, but also on-prem where relevant.

Our focus on learning is what makes us different, and our people are passionate about giving client teams the skills they need to ensure that the change we drive is sustainable once we have gone.

Customer Success Stories

Over the last 7 years we have been involved in a wide range of successful engagements that we are extremely proud of, including:

Comic Relief
- Armakuni built a platform to handle up to 500 credit card transactions per second, taking a high risk proposition involving 60 people and reducing it to a team of 5, total automation and low risk.
- Gartner case study for high availability, multi-cloud portability: Gartner: A Guidance Framework for Architecting Portable Cloud and Multicloud Applications.

RBS
- Created and currently operate the DevOps Centre of Excellence for RBS, part of the Ways of Working (WoW) Programme. Influencing the adoption of new ways of working across it's engineering workforce of 15,000.

Office for National Statistics (ONS)
- Embedded cultural change programme - a combined training and adoption programme, driven by cultural metrics, to help increase the flow of value through the organisation, through alignment and evangelism to cloud native practices for the entire engineering and support/management workforce.

jobs.title: Cloud Foundry Engineer
jobs.description:
Armakuni empower our clients to take ideas to production in weeks, not months. Cloud Foundry is a powerful tool, and our Engineers act as change catalysts, enhancing Cloud Native journeys and helping organisations maximise the value of Cloud Foundry.

Best practice. What does this actually mean? What’s “best” for one company doesn’t always work for others, right? Well, not quite. Research has shown that there are certain practices that lead to happier, more productive development teams and environments, and it’s these that we are positively evangelistic about here at Armakuni.

We seamlessly integrate XP and TDD, alongside enterprise-grade, multi-cloud tooling such as Cloud Foundry to power continuous delivery pipelines. This fundamentally improves the way teams interact to build, deploy and run software; accelerating development velocity and reducing feedback cycles.

What we enjoy:

* Utilising our knowledge of Cloud Foundry to ensure this powerful tool is fully utilised and delivering maximum value.
* Delivering world-class Cloud Foundry based PaaS environments
* Crafting elegant micro-service products to be used at extreme scale
* Pair Programming in a collaborative, open-plan environment (with table tennis!)
* Utilising TDD to deliver the highest calibre of code
* Regular retrospectives to figure out what we’re doing wrong and fix it, and what we’re doing right to improve on it.
* Enable engineers to own the services they develop and affect change directly

A Cloud Foundry Engineer at Armakuni will typically:

* Develop and deliver world-class PaaS (Cloud Foundry) microservice architectures using cloud native, PaaS and CI/CD environments
* Mentor client engineering teams in the adoption of new tools, technologies, techniques, patterns and processes
* Run and participate in workshops (inceptions) and stand-ups
* Drive adoption of cloud native practices through whatever method is practical given the obstacles encountered
* Represent Armakuni and be able to communicate our vision to client engineering teams, technical management and executives when required

What does good look like?

First and foremost you have a passion for leveraging technology to optimise processes and procedures. With a background in either software development or DevOps/SysAdmin, you are adept at leveraging Cloud Foundry in Platform-as-a-Service and everything-as-code environments, ensuring it is fully utilised to deliver maximum value.

From a technical perspective those who enjoy a successful career as a Cloud Foundry Engineer with Armakuni typically have a selection of the following:

* Strong working knowledge of deploying Cloud Foundry; either Open Source or PCF
* Exposure to a range of automation technologies such as CI/CD (Concourse etc.), BOSH and Terraform
* Experience deploying to cloud environments (eg. AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, Heroku)
* Comfortable working with Linux and BASH, bonus points for knowledge of networking
* Experience within Agile TDD/BDD or Test First development environments
* Strong communication skills - everyone at Armakuni is client-facing
* Passion for growing your skills, tackling interesting work and challenging problems
* Willingness to travel to client sites both nationally and internationally as needed

The reward:

As Armakuni continue to expand their presence in the Scottish market, the Principal Consultant will work with the Armakuni Management Team to drive further growth and success. We will give you the opportunity and freedom to help shape how we engage clients and evolve our offering in this new space, alongside:

* The chance to take ownership of your career within a rapidly evolving organisation
* Consulting environment free from sales and utilisation targets
* Weekly company-wide retros and demos
* Opportunities to visit and present at key conferences and industry events
* Regular training and informal/social knowledge sharing sessions

Of course we also make sure that you are well looked after offering highly competitive salaries plus an ever growing benefits package which currently includes:

* Annual training allowance
* Contributory pension
* 25 days holiday
* Private BUPA healthcare

*

jobs.title: Consulting Engineer (TDD, CI/CD, Lean/XP)
jobs.description:
Armakuni empower our clients to take ideas to production in weeks, not months. Our Consulting Engineers act as change catalysts, enabling teams to leverage development best practices to fully optimise their cloud journeys.

Best practice. What does this actually mean? What’s “best” for one company doesn’t always work for others, right? Well, not quite. Research has shown that there are certain practices that lead to happier, more productive development teams and environments, and it’s these that we are positively evangelistic about here at Armakuni.

Our focus is on enabling the flow of value through organisations, through a focus on the technology practice. Looking inwards, at a technical level, we do this by combining the practices of Software Craftsmanship, Agile/Lean, DevOps, Cloud Native architectures and infrastructures to create high quality, high velocity, sustainable engineering teams. Looking outwards, at the wider organisation, we interface with the wider business touchpoints for technology, finding the cross-organisational blockers to flow and driving technology driven solutions.

What we enjoy:

* Sharing our knowledge of cutting edge tech stacks with clients and colleagues alike to ensure the long-term benefits of cloud platforms are fully leveraged
* Extolling the virtues of Test Driven Development & Continuous Integration/Delivery
* Assisting with the development of elegant micro-service products used at extreme scale
* Delivering hands-on training that ensures our legacy remains long after we do
* Regular retrospectives to figure out what we’re doing wrong so we can fix it, and what we’re doing right so we can improve on it

A day in the life:

* Your primary responsibility is training and knowledge sharing with client Engineering and Development teams. As you’ve spent most of your career coding and discovering strategies for successful DevOps or Cloud Native adoption, you are enthused by the concept of transferring this to new teams as they enhance their capabilities further
* Mentoring client engineering teams in the adoption of new tools, technologies, techniques, patterns and processes, ultimately helping leverage a range of tools and methodologies
* Driving the adoption of development best practice through whatever method is practical given the obstacles encountered.
* Representing Armakuni and communicating our vision to client engineering teams, technical management and executives when required
* Delivering training and support on world-class PaaS solutions composed of best-of-breed cloud native and CI/CD tools such as Cloud Foundry, PKS and Concourse

What does good look like?

First and foremost you will have a passion for leveraging technology to optimise processes and procedures. With a background in software development you will enjoy working alongside client Engineering teams to introduce and optimise development tools and methodologies, ultimately enhancing their cloud journey.

From a technical perspective we find those who enjoy a successful career as a Consulting Software Engineer with Armakuni typically have:

* A proven track record of software/application development; we're not fussy about languages but knowledge of Ruby, Golang or Java would be a bonus
* Experience of automating deployment using CI/CD (bonus points for Concourse)
* Passion for Pair Programming and TDD - these skills are crucial in how we engage and work alongside our clients
* The ability to relay the positives and negatives of various tools, methodologies and ideas in a clear and constructive manner
* Strong communication and consulting skills - our teams are comfortable running workshops (inceptions)/standups
* Passion for growing and developing both technically and personally by tackling interesting work and challenging problems
* Ability to distill complex business requirements into simple code concepts

The reward:

We offer the chance to be a part of a rapidly evolving technology-driven community; a team of like-minded experts in sharing their knowledge not just with clients but with each other. Perks include:

* The chance to take ownership of your career within a rapidly evolving organisation; forge your own path!
* Consulting environment free from sales and utilisation targets
* Weekly company-wide retros and demos
* Opportunities to visit and present at key conferences and industry events
* Regular training and informal/social knowledge sharing sessions
* Company stickers!

Of course we also make sure that you are well looked after offering highly competitive salaries plus an ever growing benefits package which currently includes:

* Annual training allowance
* BUPA Healthcare and Employee Assistance Programme
* Shiny new MacBook Pro
* Contributory pension
* 25 days holiday

jobs.title: DevOps Consultant
jobs.description:
We have a unique opportunity for a DevOps Consultant to introduce and evangelise DevOps best practice to ensure our clients fully leverage technology for enhanced business value.

Best practice. What does this actually mean? What’s “best” for one company doesn’t always work for others, right? Well, not quite. Research has shown that there are certain practices that lead to happier, more productive development teams and environments, and it’s these that we are positively evangelistic about here at Armakuni.

Our focus is on enabling the flow of value through organisations, through a focus on the technology practice. Looking inwards, at a technical level, we do this by combining the practices of Software Craftsmanship, Agile/Lean, DevOps, Cloud Native architectures and infrastructures to create high quality, high velocity, sustainable engineering teams. Looking outwards, at the wider organisation, we interface with the wider business touchpoints for technology, finding the cross-organisational blockers to flow and driving technology driven solutions.

A day in the life:

Based primarily on client-site, Armakuni’s DevOps Consultants embed themselves within client teams, enabling them to share knowledge and implement ideas in a hands-on fashion. Day-to-day practices will typically include:

* Evangelise concepts such as clean code and microservice architecture, alongside Lean/XP practices such as TDD and Pair Programming, fundamentally improving the way our clients' teams build, deploy and run software
* Mentor client engineering teams in the adoption of new tools, technologies, techniques, patterns and processes
* Deliver and support world-class PaaS solutions composed of best-of-breed cloud native and CI/CD tools such as Cloud Foundry, PKS and Concourse
* Drive adoption of cloud native practices through whatever method is practical given the obstacles encountered
* Run and participate in workshops (inceptions) and stand-ups
* Represent Armakuni and be able to communicate our vision to client engineering teams, technical management and executives when required

What does good look like?

Armakuni fully appreciate that not many people are born with an innate ability to evangelise DevOps best practice, and this is why we offer a personalised learning journey to all our staff.

We find that successful DevOps Consultants have typically been either Developers or Systems Specialists themselves, but have realised that they now prefer leading and guiding teams in the adoption of new ideas and concepts. Typically their technical skill-set includes several of the following:

* A true passion for TDD/BDD or Test First development, and an understanding of the wider benefits such practices can bring to individuals, teams and organisations
* Experience of environments where software is deployed to cloud environments (eg. AWS, Google Cloud, Heroku, BOSH)
* Exposure to automation technologies such as CI/CD (Concourse etc.), BOSH and Terraform
* Strong communication skills - everyone at Armakuni is client-facing
* Passion for growing your skills, tackling interesting work and challenging problems
* Willingness to travel to client sites both nationally and internationally as needed

The reward:

We offer the chance to be a part of a rapidly evolving technology-driven community; a team of like-minded experts in sharing their knowledge not just with clients but with each other. Perks include:

* Opportunities to learn and use a range of bleeding-edge technologies
* Regular training and informal/social knowledge sharing sessions
* Opportunities to visit and present at key conferences and industry events
* Great community vibe; whether out on-site or at our Shoreditch HQ we all keep in touch and share ideas
* Consulting environment free from sales and utilisation targets
* Weekly company-wide retros and demos
* Company stickers!

Of course we also make sure that you are well looked after offering highly competitive salaries plus an ever growing benefits package which currently includes:

* Annual training allowance
* BUPA Healthcare and Employee Assistance Programme
* Shiny new MacBook Pro
* Contributory pension
* 25 days holiday

jobs.title: DevOps Consultant
jobs.description:
We have a unique opportunity for a DevOps Consultant to introduce and evangelise DevOps best practice to ensure our clients fully leverage technology for enhanced business value.

Best practice. What does this actually mean? What’s “best” for one company doesn’t always work for others, right? Well, not quite. Research has shown that there are certain practices that lead to happier, more productive development teams and environments, and it’s these that we are positively evangelistic about here at Armakuni.

Our focus is on enabling the flow of value through organisations, through a focus on the technology practice. Looking inwards, at a technical level, we do this by combining the practices of Software Craftsmanship, Agile/Lean, DevOps, Cloud Native architectures and infrastructures to create high quality, high velocity, sustainable engineering teams. Looking outwards, at the wider organisation, we interface with the wider business touchpoints for technology, finding the cross-organisational blockers to flow and driving technology driven solutions.

A day in the life:

Based primarily on client-site, Armakuni’s DevOps Consultants embed themselves within client teams, enabling them to share knowledge and implement ideas in a hands-on fashion. Day-to-day practices will typically include:

* Evangelise concepts such as clean code and microservice architecture, alongside Lean/XP practices such as TDD and Pair Programming, fundamentally improving the way our clients' teams build, deploy and run software
* Mentor client engineering teams in the adoption of new tools, technologies, techniques, patterns and processes
* Deliver and support world-class PaaS solutions composed of best-of-breed cloud native and CI/CD tools such as Cloud Foundry, PKS and Concourse
* Drive adoption of cloud native practices through whatever method is practical given the obstacles encountered
* Run and participate in workshops (inceptions) and stand-ups
* Represent Armakuni and be able to communicate our vision to client engineering teams, technical management and executives when required

What does good look like?

Armakuni fully appreciate that not many people are born with an innate ability to evangelise DevOps best practice, and this is why we offer a personalised learning journey to all our staff.

We find that successful DevOps Consultants have typically been either Developers or Systems Specialists themselves, but have realised that they now prefer leading and guiding teams in the adoption of new ideas and concepts. Typically their technical skill-set includes several of the following:

* A true passion for TDD/BDD or Test First development, and an understanding of the wider benefits such practices can bring to individuals, teams and organisations
* Experience of environments where software is deployed to cloud environments (eg. AWS, Google Cloud, Heroku, BOSH)
* Exposure to automation technologies such as CI/CD (Concourse etc.), BOSH and Terraform
* Strong communication skills - everyone at Armakuni is client-facing
* Passion for growing your skills, tackling interesting work and challenging problems
* Willingness to travel to client sites both nationally and internationally as needed

The reward:

We offer the chance to be a part of a rapidly evolving technology-driven community; a team of like-minded experts in sharing their knowledge not just with clients but with each other. Perks include:

* Opportunities to learn and use a range of bleeding-edge technologies
* Regular training and informal/social knowledge sharing sessions
* Opportunities to visit and present at key conferences and industry events
* Great community vibe; whether out on-site or at our Shoreditch HQ we all keep in touch and share ideas
* Consulting environment free from sales and utilisation targets
* Weekly company-wide retros and demos
* Company stickers!

Of course we also make sure that you are well looked after offering highly competitive salaries plus an ever growing benefits package which currently includes:

* Annual training allowance
* BUPA Healthcare and Employee Assistance Programme
* Shiny new MacBook Pro
* Contributory pension
* 25 days holiday

jobs.title: Principal Technical Trainer (Cloud/DevOps)
jobs.description:
Are you passionate about designing and delivering creative, “outside of the box” training? 

Do you want to be a part of a growing organisation where the value of learning and development is truly appreciated and practiced? 

Are you excited by the opportunity to make something your own?

If you were answering yes to the above our Principal Technical Trainer role may be exactly the kind of role you didn't even realise you were looking for!

As we’ve grown we’ve identified that the world-class technical training we offer, both to our clients and internally, is rapidly becoming a product in its own right. We’re now on the hunt for an ambitious and forward-thinking individual to join our team to grow and develop our offering in an area crucial to Armakuni’s ongoing success.

Your challenge:

We are a technical consultancy driven by agile approaches and led by practitioners and craftspeople. We build context specific, technology focussed training for each client engagement; whilst the principals remain the same the context (tools, practices etc.) will vary. Every course delivered requires 1-2 months work, becoming a product in its own right, giving you the opportunity to shape your own product.

The Principal Technical Trainer role with Armakuni will be varied and continue to grow and expand as we do. We envision key elements of your role to be:

Developing and building interactive, context-specific courses and training materials for our clients’ Software Development teams. 
Working alongside Armakuni engagement teams to ascertain the most appropriate training content and methodology for client teams.
Fostering and further nurturing the culture and environment of Continuous Learning we’ve worked so hard to achieve. You’ll readily act as a Product Owner for the learning pathways and networks we create for our staff, helping to maximise our teams’ capabilities.
Working alongside the Armakuni management team to ensure we remain at the bleeding edge of technical developments; ensuring training and documentation available to Armakuni staff allows us to maintain our position and the head of the curve of technical consultancy.
Developing the content which allows both Armakuni and client teams to fully embrace The AK Way - our opinionated approach to the agile process combined with practices and tools which ensure an increased rate of innovation and value.
Ensuring on-site teams consistently deliver innovative and engaging training; we’re rightly proud of the phenomenal feedback our training receives and we’re not about to rest on our laurels! 

What does good look like?

We’re not looking for your atypical trainer for this role; our engagements are technology-driven and as such you should be too. You may be an Engineer who has realised they enjoy sharing knowledge and ideas just as much as coding, or possibly even a career-trainer with a secret Git repository that you are aching to share!

We’d be keen to speak to those with a blend of the following attributes:

Above all, you have passion and ambition. You’ll be entrusted and supported with growing the Training and Development function of Armakuni which acts as a service to not only our clients, but also our community of knowledge-hungry consultants. 
A technical background; although you may not have coded in anger recently, you will have a technical understanding of Cloud Native tools and methodologies such as Continuous Deployment and microservice architectures, and an appreciation of the value they offer.
You have the ability to develop interactive materials needed to transfer knowledge between both internal and external teams. Our training is activity-led and focussed around the teams, adopting interactive, “back of the classroom” methods rather than death-by-Powerpoint
An understanding of agile practices, processes and artifacts; you will be an advocate of the wider value practices such as MVP, XP, Pair Programming, BDD and TDD can bring to the development process
You display a genuine passion for forging strong relationships with both external client stakeholders and internal colleagues of all levels.

The reward:

We offer the chance to help shape a rapidly evolving technology-driven community with learning and personal growth at the heart of what we do. You’ll be amongst friends; we’re a team of like-minded experts sharing our knowledge not just with clients but with each other. Perks include:
 
The chance to take ownership of your career within a rapidly evolving organisation; forge your own path!
The opportunity to create and own training and development as a product in its own right, both internally and client facing.
There may be an opportunity to build your own team to deliver the product you have created.
Opportunities to visit and present at key conferences and industry events.
Regular training and informal/social knowledge sharing sessions.
 
Of course we also make sure that you are well looked after offering highly competitive salaries plus an ever growing benefits package which currently includes:
 
Private BUPA healthcare.
Annual training allowance.
Contributory pension.
25 days holiday.
Choose your own hardware or BYD, it’s your choice.

Do you want to be a part of a growing organisation where the value of learning and development is truly appreciated and practiced?

If you were answering yes to the above our Principal Technical Trainer role may be exactly the kind of role you didn't even realise you were looking for!

As we’ve grown we’ve identified that the world-class technical training we offer, both to our clients and internally, is rapidly becoming a product in its own right. We’re now on the hunt for an ambitious and forward-thinking individual to join our team to grow and develop our offering in an area crucial to Armakuni’s ongoing success.

Your challenge:

We are a technical consultancy driven by agile approaches and led by practitioners and craftspeople. We build context specific, technology focussed training for each client engagement; whilst the principals remain the same the context (tools, practices etc.) will vary. Every course delivered requires 1-2 months work, becoming a product in its own right, giving you the opportunity to shape your own product.

The Principal Technical Trainer role with Armakuni will be varied and continue to grow and expand as we do. We envision key elements of your role to be:

Developing and building interactive, context-specific courses and training materials for our clients’ Software Development teams.
Working alongside Armakuni engagement teams to ascertain the most appropriate training content and methodology for client teams.
Fostering and further nurturing the culture and environment of Continuous Learning we’ve worked so hard to achieve. You’ll readily act as a Product Owner for the learning pathways and networks we create for our staff, helping to maximise our teams’ capabilities.
Working alongside the Armakuni management team to ensure we remain at the bleeding edge of technical developments; ensuring training and documentation available to Armakuni staff allows us to maintain our position and the head of the curve of technical consultancy.
Developing the content which allows both Armakuni and client teams to fully embrace The AK Way - our opinionated approach to the agile process combined with practices and tools which ensure an increased rate of innovation and value.
Ensuring on-site teams consistently deliver innovative and engaging training; we’re rightly proud of the phenomenal feedback our training receives and we’re not about to rest on our laurels!

What does good look like?

We’re not looking for your atypical trainer for this role; our engagements are technology-driven and as such you should be too. You may be an Engineer who has realised they enjoy sharing knowledge and ideas just as much as coding, or possibly even a career-trainer with a secret Git repository that you are aching to share!

We’d be keen to speak to those with a blend of the following attributes:

Above all, you have passion and ambition. You’ll be entrusted and supported with growing the Training and Development function of Armakuni which acts as a service to not only our clients, but also our community of knowledge-hungry consultants.
A technical background; although you may not have coded in anger recently, you will have a technical understanding of Cloud Native tools and methodologies such as Continuous Deployment and microservice architectures, and an appreciation of the value they offer.
You have the ability to develop interactive materials needed to transfer knowledge between both internal and external teams. Our training is activity-led and focussed around the teams, adopting interactive, “back of the classroom” methods rather than death-by-Powerpoint
An understanding of agile practices, processes and artifacts; you will be an advocate of the wider value practices such as MVP, XP, Pair Programming, BDD and TDD can bring to the development process
You display a genuine passion for forging strong relationships with both external client stakeholders and internal colleagues of all levels.

The reward:

We offer the chance to help shape a rapidly evolving technology-driven community with learning and personal growth at the heart of what we do. You’ll be amongst friends; we’re a team of like-minded experts sharing our knowledge not just with clients but with each other. Perks include:

The chance to take ownership of your career within a rapidly evolving organisation; forge your own path!
The opportunity to create and own training and development as a product in its own right, both internally and client facing.
There may be an opportunity to build your own team to deliver the product you have created.
Opportunities to visit and present at key conferences and industry events.
Regular training and informal/social knowledge sharing sessions.
